content.description:
“The aim has been to build this huge network of roads not only with the mechanical instruments of the real builder, but also with artistic feeling and a love of nature and her soothing influence. The deeper and spiritual movement of the National Socialist revolution, which signifies a psychic and cultural renovation of the German citizen, is plainly detectable in this undertaking. The white ribbons of the motor roads are carefully embedded in the landscape, and their layout is harmoniously adapted to it. . . . These efforts to make out of nature and technology one perfect unit characterizes the work of the Reich motor roads as one of great importance. . . . Technology and art, nature and life, are to take on a new form as a result of this creative spirit . . . . The new roads lend a new character to the German landscape. The open, stretched lines which pass through the landscape force the eye to follow in their direction and the starting place and destination are more clearly marked. . . . German men and women will see these roads and the vastness of the scene will help them to think on broader lines than was heretofore possible.”
Fritz Todt, Nazi roads minister, 1930s
content.question: European countries undertook infrastructure projects such as the one described in the passage in order to counter the effects of which of the following?

choices.label: The onset of the Great Depression
The growing influence of the United States in European affairs
The popularity of Lenin’s New Economic Policy
The critiques by Green parties of environmental damage associated with industry

content.answer: The onset of the Great Depression
